items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal 'actively looking' for January deals
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said the club are prepared to ease their injury problems by "actively looking" at signing new players when the transfer window reopens next month.

items.title: Slot frustrated over injuries to Liverpool signings
items.summary: Liverpool have yet to get full value from their huge summer spending spree because of the injuries they have suffered, according to head coach Arne Slot.

items.title: Zielinski geeft Inzaghi trap na: 'Ik was een C-keuze'
items.summary: Piotr Zielinski is niet bepaald rouwig om het vertrek van trainer Simone Inzaghi van Inter naar Al-Hilal. De Poolse middenvelder voelt veel meer vertrouwen van Inzaghi's opvolger Cristian Chivu, die volgens Zielinski meer spelers in de plannen betrekt.

items.title: I thought I was going to die after collapse - Rush
items.summary: Liverpool legend Ian Rush says he thought he was close to dying after contracting superflu earlier in December and spending five days in hospital.

items.title: Time is right to change Man Utd formation - Amorim
items.summary: Head coach Ruben Amorim says if he had changed Manchester United's formation because of media pressure it would have been "the end" for him.

items.title: Ruben Amorim praises Bruno Fernandes for being a leader even when injured

Fernandes could be out for up to three more weeks after sustaining a hamstring problem in United‚Äôs 2-1 defeat at Aston Villa on 21 December. Amorim was asked if the 31-year-old is still an influence on the team and offered a humorous response regarding his own role. Continue reading...

items.title: Amorim: Man Utd couldn't change formation due to media pressure
items.summary: Ruben Amorim says Manchester United's days of solely playing with a back three are over and revealed he refrained from changing formation earlier to ensure his players did not feel he was caving in to media pressure.

items.title: Gravenberch en Reijnders geprezen: 'Begint te laten zien wat hij bij Milan deed'
items.summary: Troy Deeney heeft Ryan Gravenberch en Tijjani Reijnders opgenomen in zijn Premier League-elftal van de Week, dat hij voor de BBC maakt. De voormalig topspits is onder de indruk van de twee Nederlanders na hun optredens tegen respectievelijk Wolverhampton Wandereres en Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Infantino defends World Cup ticket prices
items.summary: Fifa president Gianni Infantino defends the cost of World Cup tickets following "absolutely crazy" demand from the public.

items.title: Elftal van het Jaar: twee Nederlanders krijgen voorkeur boven wereldtoppers

items.summary: Anthony Joshua has been injured in a car crash in Nigeria that killed two people.
